channel.title: Does the BMS soundtrack seem mysterious & scary enough?
channel.description:
Hey guys, I'm new. Anyways, I've been listening to the BMS soundtrack, and don't get me wrong, it is great, it's just, not as scary and mysterious and it was in HL1.
Here is what I mean,
BMS: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VvpLGFF2Pm0[/url]
HL1: [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Fn2anyX1gk&feature=related[/url] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FmRO1RNuihA&feature=related[/url] [url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=urSDdiPrhb8&feature=related[/url]
You see, the HL1 soundtrack is actually way more scarier than the BMS one, it actually gives me the creeps :S where as BMS soundtrack seems more sad and bad-ass, but forgets the intensity of what the HL1 soundtrack provides.
Please note, I'm not saying the BMS soundtrack is bad, I'm just saying it should be remade into something more scary & mysterious. Then again, it is good to be different from the original.
Do you agree? Do you see where I'm coming from?

item.title: Does the BMS soundtrack seem mysterious & scary enough?
item.dc:creator: Moooooooose
item.description:
The Blast Pit theme always gives me shivers when I listen to it, it’s so eerie.

Also, Demo 2 feels like the sort of thing that would be used to unveil the test chamber for the first time.

Read full topic
item.source: Does the BMS soundtrack seem mysterious & scary enough?

item.title: Does the BMS soundtrack seem mysterious & scary enough?
item.dc:creator: Nickmadkiller
item.description:
First off Half-Life wasn’t supposed to be a scary like Doom 3 or Fear 1,2.So Black Mesa won’t lead into those tracks.

Sure it can be a frightening at times but for real…the music fits it’s style and we could always use a great beat in a HUGE showdown with a giant alien with claws coming out of their dang eyeballs…anyways theres my statement .

Read full topic

item.title: Does the BMS soundtrack seem mysterious & scary enough?
item.dc:creator: MaKTaiL
item.description:
I like Track 17. It is the end/credits song. It is just… epic.
You listen to it right after you take the deal to work with the misterious G-Man.
The game just ends like that with this song and you are like: HOLY FU**** I WANNA PLAY HL2!

Anyway, that’s how I felt at the time. xDD Here is the link to the song:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8kSLXI1DBLQ

Read full topic

item.source: Does the BMS soundtrack seem mysterious & scary enough?

item.title: Does the BMS soundtrack seem mysterious & scary enough?
item.dc:creator: Redhotpengy
item.description:
nietzschesaurus:

No, that’s not what I said at all. Reading comprehension, do you have it? BM has multiple styles of music, just as HL did. In fact BM appears to have an even wider selection of genres then HL did, based on what we’ve seen so far. They aren’t the exact same songs, but they’re worthy in their own right.

It doesn’t make sense because it’s pointless. The music they have now is good and fitting. Why fix something that isn’t broken? When they built the Great Wall of China do you think someone came up and said “yeah, it’s good, but I think we could do better–let’s tear the whole thing down and start over”? No, they didn’t, because it’s retarded.

Yes, I’m comparing BM’s music to the mother fucking Great Wall of China.

Your right.

Read full topic

item.title: Does the BMS soundtrack seem mysterious & scary enough?
item.dc:creator: nietzschesaurus
item.description:
Redhotpengy:

Your saying that because I like the music, it should fit every single genre?

No, that’s not what I said at all. Reading comprehension, do you have it? BM has multiple styles of music, just as HL did. In fact BM appears to have an even wider selection of genres then HL did, based on what we’ve seen so far. They aren’t the exact same songs, but they’re worthy in their own right.

redhotpenis:

Some songs are good, but sometimes are better in a different style. How does that not make sense?

It doesn’t make sense because it’s pointless. The music they have now is good and fitting. Why fix something that isn’t broken? When they built the Great Wall of China do you think someone came up and said “yeah, it’s good, but I think we could do better–let’s tear the whole thing down and start over”? No, they didn’t, because it’s retarded.

Yes, I’m comparing BM’s music to the mother fucking Great Wall of China.

Read full topic
